decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly cast spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with burn spells and card draw. The deck aims to be aggressive and tempo-oriented, utilizing cards like Treasure Cruise and Consider to fill up the graveyard for Phoenix's return. Lightning Axe and Fiery Impulse provide removal for opposing threats, while Picklock Prankster helps to maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes versatile spells like Opt and Sleight of Hand for card selection and manipulation.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and aggressive spirit creature strategy. The deck includes cards that can protect your creatures, disrupt your opponent's plans, and generate card advantage. By utilizing the synergy between the spirit creatures and unique spells in the deck, you can quickly build a strong board presence and maintain control of the game. The focus is on being proactive and applying pressure early on to force your opponent to react defensively, allowing you to dictate the flow of the game.

This deck focuses on using the Greasefang Parhelion combo to generate a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes cards that enable the combo like Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II, as well as support cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push for disruption. The goal is to create a strong, synergistic engine that can generate advantage and put pressure on the opponent quickly. The deck also includes a mix of lands and protection spells to ensure consistency and resilience during gameplay.

This UW Control deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It utilizes cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, Narset, Parter of Veils, and Dovin's Veto to control the board and outvalue the opponent. It also includes land disruption with Field of Ruin and Floodfarm Verge, along with card selection and draw spells like Consult the Star Charts and Memory Deluge. By slowing down the opponent and accumulating resources, this deck aims to establish dominance on the battlefield and secure victory through attrition.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on equipping creatures with powerful artifacts like Colossus Hammer to deal massive damage quickly. It also includes cards like Sigarda's Aid and Shadowspear to enhance the effectiveness of these artifacts in combat. The deck also features creatures with relevant abilities like Kellan and Kemba to maintain board presence. With a mana base that includes fast lands and pain lands, the deck aims to pressure opponents early and maintain a strong offensive presence throughout the game.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on a relentless and aggressive playstyle, aiming to quickly overwhelm the opponent with efficient creature removal, disruptive hand disruption, and powerful threats. The deck utilizes a mix of powerful creatures like Blightstep Pathway and Bloodtithe Harvester, along with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to keep the opponent on the back foot. With a mix of direct damage, creature removal, and hand disruption, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while quickly closing out the game with aggressive creatures.

The focus of this red aggro deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by utilizing efficient creatures and burn spells. Cards like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Heartfire Hero can help control the board, while Monstrous Rage and Burst Lightning provide direct damage to the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Shadowspear and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance give additional utility and flexibility in combat. Overall, the strategy is to apply pressure early and maintain aggression throughout the game to secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to establish board control through removal spells and counterspells, while also utilizing card advantage from cards like Consult the Star Charts and Memory Deluge. The deck also aims to lock out the opponent with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, while generating value from cards like March of Otherworldly Light and The Wandering Emperor. By controlling the board and out-valuing the opponent, this deck seeks to grind out a win through attrition and card advantage.

The main concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent using aggressive creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Mutavault, backed up by removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to clear the way. Thoughtseize and Duress disrupt the opponent's game plan while cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Fear of Missing Out provide additional value. Blade of the Oni and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse bring powerful threats to the table, while Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance provides a way to close out the game. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a mix of aggression and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent with a combination of low-cost spells and creatures. The deck focuses on utilizing card draw and cantrips to maintain a steady stream of threats while also utilizing prowess abilities to pump up creatures and finish off opponents. The inclusion of Dreadhorde Arcanist enables the player to recur instants and sorceries from the graveyard, providing additional value and flexibility in the late game. Overall, the deck aims to maintain pressure and tempo throughout the game to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing Niv-Mizzet Reborn as a key control piece, supported by a variety of multicolored cards to take advantage of his ability. The deck contains a mix of removal spells, versatile threats, and powerful utility lands, alongside cards like Bring to Light and Fabled Passage to ensure consistency and flexibility. The inclusion of Leyline Binding and Ancient Cornucopia demonstrates a focus on resource denial and incremental advantage, while the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad offers additional value and resilience in longer games. Ultimately, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through careful resource management and strategic play.

The deck focuses on creating a powerful combo with Greasefang and Parhelion II while using a mix of removal spells and protection to control the board. It aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces while disrupting the opponent's strategy with Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The mana base is optimized to support the combo pieces and provide some flexibility in generating the right colors of mana. The deck has a strong focus on synergy and efficiency, aiming to overwhelm opponents with its powerful combo finish.

This deck focuses on the aggressive use of low-cost, high-impact creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It utilizes cards like Bonecrusher Giant and Emberheart Challenger to control the board while continuously pushing damage with cards like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Monstrous Rage. The inclusion of cards like Burst Lightning and Lightning Strike provide additional direct damage options, while creatures like Manifold Mouse and Sunspine Lynx offer versatile threats. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless assault of creatures and burn spells to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on aggressively disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger. It aims to control the board through removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, while also utilizing powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance. The deck is able to maintain its aggression with lands that can produce both red and black mana efficiently, allowing for a consistent stream of threats to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck is focused on quick, aggressive plays, aiming to deal damage as quickly as possible to the opponent. Key cards like Bonecrusher Giant and Emberheart Challenger help control the board while creatures like Manifold Mouse and Kumano Faces Kakkazan provide consistent pressure. The deck also includes burn spells like Burst Lightning and Lightning Strike to finish off opponents or remove threats. With a mix of creatures and burn spells, as well as some land disruption with Den of the Bugbear and Ramunap Ruins, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient plays.

The main focus of this Mono Black Control deck is to utilize powerful disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize to strip away opponents' key cards, while deploying threats like Liliana of the Veil and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to control the battlefield. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to deal with opposing creatures. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Gifted Aetherborn and Graveyard Trespasser to provide lifegain and additional value. The mana base is focused on providing consistent black mana sources for the deck's various spells and abilities.
